[[File:JauntyGUI.png|thumb|300px|Ubuntu 9.04 with custom theme]]
'''Ubuntu''' ({{pron-en|uËËbuËntuË}}<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.ubuntu.com/aboutus/faq/ | title = Frequently Asked Questions | publisher = Ubuntu | accessdate = 2008-05-13 }}</ref> {{respell|'''oo'''|B'''OO'''N|t'''oo'''}}),<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ODQ4WiDsEBQ YouTube - The Ubuntu Experience (Nelson Mandela Interview)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.ubuntu.com/aboutus/faq Frequently Asked Questions | Ubuntu<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> is a computer [[operating system]] based on the [[Debian]] [[Linux distribution]]. It is named after the [[South Africa]]n ethical ideology ''[[Ubuntu (philosophy)|Ubuntu]]'' ("humanity towards others")<ref>[https://help.ubuntu.com/9.04/about-ubuntu/C/about-ubuntu-name.html Ubuntu Documentation: About the Name]</ref> and is distributed as [[free and open source software]]. Ubuntu provides an up-to-date, stable operating system for the average user, with a strong focus on [[usability]] and ease-of-installation. Ubuntu has been selected by readers of desktoplinux.com as the most popular [[Linux]] distribution for the desktop, claiming approximately 30% of Linux desktop installations in both 2006 and 2007.<ref name="Market Survey 2006">{{cite web | title = 2006 [[Desktop Linux]] Market survey | url = http://www.desktoplinux.com/cgi-bin/survey/survey.cgi?view=archive&id=0821200617613 | date = [[2006-08-29]] | accessdate = 2009-05-03 }}</ref><ref name="Market Survey 2007">{{cite web | title = 2007 [[Desktop Linux]] Market survey | url = http://www.desktoplinux.com/cgi-bin/survey/survey.cgi?view=archive&id=0813200712407 | date = [[2007-08-21]] | accessdate = 2008-08-19 }}</ref>
'''Ubuntu''' ({{pron-en|uËËbuËntuË}}<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.ubuntu.com/aboutus/faq/ | title = Frequently Asked Questions | publisher = Ubuntu | accessdate = 2008-05-13 }}</ref> {{respell|'''oo'''|B'''OO'''N|t'''oo'''}}),<ref>[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ODQ4WiDsEBQ YouTube - The Ubuntu Experience (Nelson Mandela Interview)<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[http://www.ubuntu.com/aboutus/faq Frequently Asked Questions | Ubuntu<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> is a computer [[operating system]] based on the [[Debian]] [[Linux distribution]]. It is named after the [[South Africa]]n ethical ideology ''[[Ubuntu (philosophy)|Ubuntu]]'' ("humanity towards others")<ref>[https://help.ubuntu.com/9.04/about-ubuntu/C/about-ubuntu-name.html Ubuntu Documentation: About the Name]</ref> and is distributed as [[free and open source software]]. Ubuntu provides an up-to-date, stable operating system for the average user, with a strong focus on [[usability]] and ease-of-installation. Ubuntu has been selected by readers of desktoplinux.com as the most popular [[Linux]] distribution for the desktop, claiming approximately 30% of Linux desktop installations in both 2006 and 2007.<ref name="Market Survey 2006">{{cite web | title = 2006 [[Desktop Linux]] Market survey | url = http://www.desktoplinux.com/cgi-bin/survey/survey.cgi?view=archive&id=0821200617613 | date = [[2006-08-29]] | accessdate = 2009-05-03 }}</ref><ref name="Market Survey 2007">{{cite web | title = 2007 [[Desktop Linux]] Market survey | url = http://www.desktoplinux.com/cgi-bin/survey/survey.cgi?view=archive&id=0813200712407 | date = [[2007-08-21]] | accessdate = 2008-08-19 }}</ref>
